meanings.definition: A bristle or tuft of hair
meanings.sent1: The cat's birse stood up when it saw a dog.
meanings.sent2: She brushed her hand over the birse of the hedgehog.
meanings.sent3: The birse of the lion's mane made it look like a fluffy pillow.
meanings.sent4: The birse of grass on the lawn swayed in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The birse of the porcupine's quills served as its protection.

meanings.sent1: He tends to birse when things don't go his way.
meanings.sent2: She will birse if you keep interrupting her.
meanings.sent3: The baby started to birse when his toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: The teacher could feel herself beginning to birse at the noisy students.
meanings.sent5: Try not to birse over small inconveniences; stay calm instead.
